org.tantalum.storage

Class ImageTypeHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tantalum.storage.ImageTypeHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataTypeHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AndroidImageTypeHandler, JMEImageTypeHandler

    public abstract class ImageTypeHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataTypeHandler
    This DataTypeHandler for use with a StaticCache converts from compressed byte[] format (JPG, PNG, etc) to the platform-specific Image class. Call PlatformUtils.getImageTypeHandler() to receive the implementation appropriate for you current platform. You can optionally set parameters on how images are handled to automatically shrink images before they are kept in heap memory in the StaticCache. Some platform implementations, such as Android, may choose to ignore these resize commands in which case the platform-specific UI in your view is expected to resize images as appropriate. Note that image resizes by powers of 2 default to faster but still minimally lossy scaling algorithms automatically.

      If the source image is larger than maxWidith and/or maxHeight, should the image keep the same width/height ratio after resizing.
      static int SCALING_DISABLED
      This value, used by default, means no bounding box is specified and the image will be returned at full original size on this dimension.

    • Field Detail

      • SCALING_DISABLED

        public static final int SCALING_DISABLED
        This value, used by default, means no bounding box is specified and the image will be returned at full original size on this dimension.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • algorithm

        protected int algorithm
        Select the image resize algorithm from among the cross-platform algorithms available in ImageUtils. Some produce faster results, some sharper, some smoother, some support alpha blending. The default value for JME is ImageUtils.FIVE_POINT_BLEND which is fast and smooth and supports alpha translucency. The Android implementation does not implement scaling. It recommends the default Android use of native scaling algorithms in the UI layer itself so this value is not used.

      • preserveAspectRatio

        protected boolean preserveAspectRatio
        If the source image is larger than maxWidith and/or maxHeight, should the image keep the same width/height ratio after resizing. The default value is true, which prevents the "squeezed" look of non-proportional image resize. This might be useful effect in some cases.

      • maxWidth

        protected int maxWidth
        The maximum width of the image expected from this routine by the UI view. Images larger than this will be scaled down to fit. The default value is -1, which means no resizing.

      • maxHeight

        protected int maxHeight
        The maximum height of the image expected from this routine by the UI view. Images larger than this will be scaled down to fit. The default value is -1, which means no resizing.

        public ImageTypeHandler()

    • Method Detail

      • setAlgorithm

        public void setAlgorithm(int algorithm)
        Set the scaling algorithm to be used. Choose from among the public constants in ImageUtils. If you want to use native or other scaling not included in Tantalum, you should extend DataTypeHandler directly rather than modify the cross-platform ImageTypeHandler.
        Parameters:
        algorithm -

      • setPreserveAspectRatio

        public void setPreserveAspectRatio(boolean preserveAspectRatio)
        Turn this to false to allow the image scaling algorithm to maximally fill the maxWidth and maxHeight for distortion effects. Images will not be expanded. The default if true.
        Parameters:
        preserveAspectRatio -

      • getPreserveAspectRatio

        public boolean getPreserveAspectRatio()
        Get the current aspect ratio image scaling mode setting.
        Returns:

      • setMaxSize

        public void setMaxSize(int maxWidth,
              int maxHeight)
        Set the bounding box which images must fit within when loaded with this handler. Because thse are locked to the StaticWebCache, you should create a different StaticWebCache for each automatically scaled image size you support. By default, image scaling is off unless you set a bounding box.
        Parameters:
        maxWidth -
        maxHeight -

      • getMaxWidth

        public int getMaxWidth()
        Get the current width bound used for image scaling. The default is -1 for image scaling off.
        Returns:

      • getMaxHeight

        public int getMaxHeight()
        Get the current height bound user for image scaling. The default is -1 for image scaling off.
        Returns:
